title: Smash-Up: The Story of a Woman

sources.title: Smash-Up: The Story of a Woman
sources.description: A successful singer Angelica Evans (Susan Hayward) gives up her career and marries unsuccessful singer Ken Conway (Lee Bowman). She happily sacrifices for him and his partner (Eddie Albert). Eventually he DOES hit it big, she has a baby...but he never has time for her--his rising career comes first. She slowly drifts into alcoholism.

sources.title: Smash-Up! The Story of a Woman (1947) SUSAN HAYWARD
sources.description:
Stars: Susan Hayward, Lee Bowman, Eddie Albert, Marsha Hunt
Director: Stuart Heisler
Original Story: Dorothy Parker/Frank Cavett

In this gender reversal of "A Star is Born," a talented nightclub singer trades her career for marriage to a budding singer/songwriter.  He becomes a big star; she has a baby but soon falls into alcoholism.  According to Hollywood gossip, this is a thinly disguised re-telling of Bing Crosby and his first wife, the singer-actress Dixie Lee.

metadata.Plot: Fast-rising nightclub singer, Angie Evans, interrupts her career to marry struggling songwriter Ken Conway. When Ken lucks into a career as a chart-topping radio crooner, Angie's forced into idle luxury which proves her downfall. Her alcoholism grows ever more and Ken remains clueless concerning his part in her problems.
